summary: This is a US Marshals Service prisoner schedule report for the Manhattan courthouse (500 Pearl St.) dated August 13, 2019. It lists multiple detainees from the Brooklyn Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC) scheduled for various court appearances, including status hearings, arraignments, and changes of plea. The document is administrative and does not directly mention Jeffrey Epstein or his associates.

persons.name: Woods Gregory
persons.context: Listed as the presiding judge for a detainee's court appearance for a dangerous drugs offense.

persons.name: Daniels G
persons.context: Listed as the presiding judge for a detainee's change of plea hearing for a wire fraud offense.

persons.name: Carter A
persons.context: Listed as the presiding judge for a detainee's status hearing for multiple offenses.

persons.name: Furman J
persons.context: Listed as the presiding judge for multiple detainees' status hearings for various offenses including dangerous drugs and weapon offenses.

persons.name: Stein S
persons.context: Listed as the presiding judge for a detainee's sentencing hearing and another detainee's status hearing.

persons.name: Buchwald N
persons.context: Listed as the presiding judge for a detainee's status hearing for a dangerous drugs offense.

events.title: Multiple Court Appearances Scheduled
events.description: A schedule of court appearances for detainees from Brooklyn MDC at the Manhattan courthouse, including status hearings, arraignments, changes of plea, and a sentencing.

locations: 40 Foley Square, New York, NY (Courtroom locations)
keyFacts: This is a routine prisoner transport and court schedule document from August 13, 2019.
The document lists multiple federal judges (Woods, Daniels, Carter, Furman, Stein, Buchwald) presiding over various criminal cases.
The detainees face charges including dangerous drugs, wire fraud, weapon offenses, homicide, and theft of government property.
One detainee is noted as a 'PRIOR LAW ENFORCEMENT OFFICER' with a 'TAKE OUT ORDER' scheduled from September 9, 2019, to February 25, 2020.
The document itself contains no direct references to Jeffrey Epstein, Ghislaine Maxwell, or any known figures from the Epstein case.
